âœ¨ cronmaster | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a centralized, user-friendly web interface for managing and monitoring cron jobs and associated scripts, simplifying task scheduling and execution logging.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Modern UI with dark/light mode â€¢ System Information display (uptime, memory, CPU, etc.) â€¢ Cron Job Management (view, create, delete) â€¢ Script Management (view, create, delete bash scripts) â€¢ Job Execution Logging (stdout, stderr, exit codes, timestamps)
ðŸ“– Summary: Cronmaster is a TypeScript-based web UI for managing cron jobs. It offers a user-friendly interface for creating, viewing, and deleting cron jobs and associated bash scripts, with features like live logging, log history, and system information display.

ðŸš€ drip | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To securely expose a local development server or service to the internet for testing, collaboration, or public access, using a custom domain and without relying on external tunneling services.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Self-hosted tunneling â€¢ Secure exposure of local services â€¢ Unlimited bandwidth and requests â€¢ No third-party servers â€¢ Use of own domain
ðŸ“– Summary: Drip is a self-hosted tunneling solution written in Go that allows users to securely expose local services to the internet without relying on third-party servers. It offers unlimited bandwidth and requests, enabling users to use their own domains for custom subdomains.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ OSX-PROXMOX | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To enable users to easily install and run macOS as a virtual machine on Proxmox VE, effectively creating a Hackintosh within a virtualization platform.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Easy installation of macOS on Proxmox VE â€¢ Support for AMD and Intel hardware â€¢ Wide range of macOS versions supported (High Sierra to Sequoia) â€¢ Support for Proxmox VE versions 7.XX to 8.XX â€¢ Includes OpenCore version 1.0.4
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides a streamlined script to install and run macOS virtual machines on Proxmox VE, supporting a wide range of macOS and Proxmox versions on both AMD and Intel hardware. It simplifies the complex process of Hackintoshing within a virtualization environment.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ gpu-hot | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Real-time monitoring and visualization of NVIDIA GPU performance and system metrics for single machines or clusters, particularly useful for MLOps, AI/ML workloads, and DevOps.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Real-time GPU metrics (sub-second) â€¢ Automatic multi-GPU detection â€¢ Process monitoring (PID, memory usage) â€¢ Historical charts (utilization, temperature, power, clocks) â€¢ System metrics (CPU, RAM)
ðŸ“– Summary: GPU Hot is a real-time, web-based dashboard for monitoring NVIDIA GPUs. It provides detailed metrics for utilization, memory, temperature, and processes, accessible without SSH, and can scale from single machines to large clusters.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ Dropp | Swift
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Seamlessly transferring and accessing files across macOS and Android devices through a cloud-synced dropzone.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Completely Open-Source â€¢ Cloud Sync â€¢ Native macOS Dropzone â€¢ Native Android App â€¢ Secure Authentication
ðŸ“– Summary: Dropp is a cross-platform application that provides a persistent dropzone on macOS, allowing users to drag files and sync them to the cloud. These files can then be accessed on other devices, such as Android phones, creating a seamless file transfer and accessibility experience across multiple platforms.
